data.title: Birth And Death Certificates
data.text:
We can provide birth and death certificates that occurred in any Colorado county. Certified birth and death certificates are legal documents that are printed on forgery-resistant safety paper with watermarks, raised engraving, background security patterns, and a unique certificate identification number.

How to Obtain a Birth/Death Certificate

Only certain individuals, with proof of eligibility, can be provided with vital records. Requirements are set by the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment and are the same across all Counties.

Email

Email an application to VitalRecords@arapahoegov.com, along with the required documentation listed below.

Birth Certificate Application (Solicitud de Certificado de Nacimiento)

Death Certificate Application (Solicitud de Certificado de Defuncion)

In-Person

Schedule an in-person appointment. In-person payments can be made by cash, check, money order, or credit card. Certificates are issued same day if record is ready for issuance in our system. Certificates are typically issued within 20 minutes.

Online through VitalChek

Additional fees are charged by VitalChek for online orders.

Online through Go Certificates

Additional fees are charged by Go Certificates for online orders.

Postal Mail

Print out an application and mail it to the address on the form, along with the required documentation listed below, including a check or money order, along with a photocopy of the requestor's ID.

Birth Certificate Application (Solicitud de Certificado de Nacimiento)

Death Certificate Application (Solicitud de Certificado de Defuncion)

Who Can Order Birth/Death Certificates

The person named on the birth record

Members of the immediate family, with required proof of relationship

Legal representatives of those named above

Others demonstrating a direct and tangible interest in the record

Required Information

The person's full name as it appears on the birth/death record

Date and place of birth/death

Parent's names along with mother's full maiden name

Purpose for the copy

Applicant's relationship to the person on the certificate

Applicant's signature

Payment for the number of copies requested

Photocopy of the requestor's valid identification

FAQs

What do I need to get a birth certificate for my child?

Who can obtain a birth certificate?

What are birth certificates used for?

How much does it cost to get a birth or death certificate?

How long does it take to get the birth certificate in person, by email/mail, or by online?

Do we have to go to the county that the birth occurred in? Or can I go to ANY Vital Records office?

Why does the birth certificate print with mother’s maiden name?

I don’t have an ID or documents. How can I apply for my birth certificate?

I was not born in Colorado. Can I get a birth certificate from your office?

When will I receive my child’s Social Security Card?

What do I need to make a correction on my child’s birth certificate?
